intro: Senecio hollermayerii, commonly known as the Hölzel's groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and yellow composite flowers. The plant features narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
